content.location: Start 20 feet right of the overhang system, and 50 feet right of Chickies Direct, in a large rampy corner

content.description: P1: Same as Yo YoP2: Climb the corner up and just past the overhang.  Traverse right 10’ over the overhang, then continue up face to ledge then continue up the face and corner to the top. ~100 ft

If you're climbing solo this is a great warm-up for the boulder problems in the cave. There are a few cruxy spots and some long sections of sustained climbing. Working from right to left seemed to be a little more difficult. Route can be made much more difficult using eliminates or staying under the heavily overhanging sections. 

  Great for an after-work solo/no gear required workout.
content.location: This "route" starts at the big white slabby block in a corner (rockfall hazard) and traverses right to the main face. Climb no higher than 10 ft. Highest point is climbing up around the tree that is blocking the wall.

content.protection: Standard trad rack. There are two bolted belay stations on this climb and a rap station at the top of the cliff just 10-15 feet to the right of the climb.  The final "glory pitch" takes a lot of smaller "finger-sized" cams like .3, .4, .5, and two .75s. f
content.location: This is the first climb you find walking downhill away from the Main Wall.

content.description: This area between the Cave and the Main Wall is mostly shady and overgrown. It has established two and three pitch trad routes, ranging from 5.2 to 5.10. There is a rocky trail that leads down along the base of the cliff.
